column5: North Pigeon is ice free except  some ice chunks and slush on the windy shore. Water levels rising but not to summer levels yet. Lots of standing water inland.
was hoping to chase ice out crappolas on GB...-16 this week not a chance. I was drilling through about 18 inches today...shorelines nowhere near open yet.
Water level on Sturgeon Lake looks like it might have come up a little more over night but I think it is just about as high as we are likely to see it this spring.

Levels probly have not peaked yet Haliburton watershed including the gull river the burnt and black rivers are in flood stage .... Lots of water to come from Haliburton yet they say will peak in a few days IF NO MORE RAIN
No sure if anyone has said this, but I drove by Glen Edin/ Kelso C.A yesterday and there was no ice left on the ice there
the Burnt River park outhouses were up to the roof yesterday with the current water levels...
the Burnt River park outhouses were up to the roof yesterday with the current water levels... And I didn't mean with what's inside....
No sure if anyone has said this, but I drove by Glen Edin/ Kelso C.A yesterday and there was no ice left on the ice there Thanks!
Drove South down hwy 11 Sunday...Vernon narrows is wide open as far as the eye can see and the Magnetewan river is blown open and over the banks.
The bay here is still tight, but the big lake is opening up.        If this opens up to the shore, I,ll be out fishing perch and smelts next weekend on the toon.
The ice is breaking up and on the move this morning
Seems it took for ever to get here, and forever for it to leave.
Gull Lake Friday.  There's some idiot in a canoe out there.        haha nice   ...wondering if you've heard or seen anything about the ice status on Boshkung or 12 Mile...have a place near Carnarvon

I'm going to get out on the ice a couple times this week, and then that will likely be it for my season.  Wednesday we had our sleds on 16-17" of mostly black ice, but it will go quick when the rain shows up.
Seen a adventurous boat out on pigeon this morning
Anyone have any info on lakes around milton?  Kelso, Mountsberg, Valens?  Thanks

Just got home from Sudbury, there is more ice on Sturgeon Lake today than there was on Friday Morning. I was going to go down and see if there were any crappie, I'd have to drill a hole, ice as far as I can see.
As of last night I couldn't see any ice on Sturgeon Lake. That wind seems to have ground it up pretty well.
As of last night I couldn't see any ice on Sturgeon Lake. That wind seems to have ground it up pretty well.  Thanks Cliff.
Thanks Cliff Crazy rain this month. Any flooding anywhere?
Nothing yet Capt. That I have heard of anyway. They had lowered the level of Pigeon Lake about a foot yesterday in expectation of the rains today and tomorrow.

Saturday my bro-in-law Dave and I did a little bopping around the country side and the north end of Pigeon Lake was still frozen over with a few feet of open water along the shoreline...Upper and Lower Buckhorn looked to be open water everywhere...  Tuesday afternoon I had an appointment with my cardiologist in Peterborough and noticed that Chemong was wide open...Lower Pigeon was free of ice...Today, I stopped by the Pigeon Lake (north shore) and there was still some ice out further than Saturday but not quite ice free yet...
Me thinks I,ll be tooning come sunday. It,s opening up big time here.

This morning we still had a good 90% ish coverage, probably thin though. Got home around 3 and not only no ice in sight but some good 3+ foot waves blowing in. Guess this lake is officially ice free now. Water's way up too, think the dams gonna breach again if it hasn't already.  Michael

At the south end of Sturgeon, the ice is long gone. I was in Lindsay yesterday and noted massive flow at the stoplogs by Lock 33. This morning, lake level is WAY up.  It's over top of my seawall and part way up the lawn. Typical Spring here.
Levels are definitely up on Lower Buckhorn from what I can see from the webcam from Reach Harbour Resort   http://www.reachharbour.com/  Kawartha Kev
Looks like the long rods will be collecting a little more dust round here.
My pool is finally ice free!  Penetang Harbour appears clear, Midland Harbour and the Sound partially clear. Grain boat left on Monday.

As Mike said, water levels in Sturgeon are high and rising. I would say that as of daylight this morning until now (about 3:00 pm) the water level has risen about 3". It isn't far off the highest I have seen it in 16 years. Fortunatly they aren't calling for much rain in the next week which should help let things catch up a bit.
Looks like the long rods will be collecting a little more dust round here.  Untitled.png  was hoping to chase ice out crappolas on GB...-16 this week not a chance.

Naw, water temperatures still way too cold and the water up until the last two days has been way to low for the crappie to move into the shallow areas. This cold front moving in is going to put them off their feed and it looks like it will be at least another two weeks before things start to warm up. The crappie won't even start to get active until we start to see water temperatured of at least 52°F and in my experience the most productive range is 58-62°F. We need some bright sunny days to start to warm up those shallow bays then we'll see some action.

BTW Paul I am thinking the answer is no for the docks this weekend, high water, high wind, not much point in pushing it! My son was going to come down and help me with my dock and marine railway, we've decided to hold off for at least another week and might even make it two.

I have taken lots of pics in the last week lots of ice damage in Dunsford on sturgeon lake a boathouse almost destroyed dozens of docks ripped out and major damage from the wind last Wedbesday moving the ice around and even shoreline damage ice was right up on county Rd 24 the other day as well they had to close the road for a while to remove ice
And if it gets real windy there will be more damage for sure there is no stopping the ice that's for sure
Wow thats gnarly!
Wow, I have seen it bend 8" I beams like they were wet noodles! I feel so sorry for those people that have their property destroyed by it! When it moves, nothing stops it!

It's about a 1 mile swath from the marina to our govt dock in thurstonia  on sturgeon lake !!! It has happened many times before and people just leave their wooden docks out and some years it's fine others they get crushed I knew it was going to happen last week when we had that major wind/hail storm blow through it only took about 20 mins for the ice to do all that damage !!!!! Peoples water lines are ripped out and even the marina wall looks like it's gonna collapse they just repaired it from last years ice event and it's wrecked again !!! A lot of those peoples docks are cottagers so they have no idea yet they are destroyed and there is gonna be lots of debris out on the water when it melts as all that stuff will be floating all over the lake as usual be careful first few times out and watch for things all depends on the wind again and how fast the water comes up
A mans got to do, what a mans got to do to fish.  I know Bri, that was me out there.    Crazy pictures Shawn, hopefully everybody is insured and doesn't get dicked around.
Lol, typical brock???
I know Bri, that was me out there. I was going to ask how you did a long range "selfie"
Lil fisher took the shot?
Glad that got cleared up....I had the canoe out last week and certainly didn't feel like an idiot for doing it
Spring is in the air?
Last two nights the lake has been making more ice, slush is gone for now. Looks like it will be at least two more weeks before it starts to melt again.
Lakes here are still solid but my river is breaking up
Ha! I'm jealous.

Last night there was perhaps 100' of open water between my shore and ice as far as you (I) could see. This morning there is open water right across the lake in front of our place, plenty of ice both North and South of here.  I took a little drive and there are some massive ice flows but right now they are hugging the Western shore. If they are right about the wind direction for the next couple of days we could have a problem. ESE today then WNW tomorrow then back to ESE for Saturday. That ice has lots of room to pick up momentum. My marine railway is about 6' North of where it should be, fortunatly I learned a long time ago to disconnect it from the main land so it's moved but not damaged. I think I'll wait another week or two before I re attach it LOL.  Manjo39: I know you didn't ask but the answer is NO, this would not be a good weekend to put the dock in. Had a quick look at your place today, there is still some ice against the shore line which is a good thing, it will act as a buffer if the lake ice does come back in.

I think I'll wait another week or two before I re attach it LOL.  Manjo39: I know you didn't ask but the answer is NO, this would not be a good weekend to put the dock in. Had a quick look at your place today, there is still some ice against the shore line which is a good thing, it will act as a buffer if the lake ice does come back in.    Lol!  Thanks Cliff.  You read my mind and answered my question.  I'm guessing 2nd weekend of April. I always look forward to this thread every year

Lol!  Thanks Cliff.  You read my mind and answered my question.  I'm guessing 2nd weekend of April. Well it is an early spring but they are calling for a much colder than normal April and even early May. I may try to get my dock in next weekend if all the ice has broken up which I think it will be. I'll keep an eye on things and let you know what's happening. Regardless, you know you are always welcome in my boat anytime so you don't need to rush at getting yours in.
main part of sturgeon wide open as well, several large ice sheets still there floating around, at least with the wind my shoreline and boould be okathouse sh

All depends on the wind and it's going to switch around and come from the northwest and blow all the ice from the long beach side back again it was blowing from the east. But they have also dropped the lake at least a foot in the last few days to ease the breakup ..... But lots of big size ice sheets & chunks out there also floating docks & debris

With all the warm temps it's looking like many lakes in Southern Ontario have begun to break up.  Parts of Lake Simcoe, Rice Lake and the Tri-lakes seem to show open water.  Be careful if you are brave enough to venture out!!

We're going to lose a bunch of snow from today thru to Wednesday, but it's supposed to stay at or below zero for at least a week by next weekend so I should be able to stay on the ice until the end of the month (we haven't really lost any ice yet but the snow conditions suck)

4 days of rain and high single to low double digits next week should wash out a lot.  Keeping an eye on the Black River flow data - it's shot up a lot in the last 2 days.  They haven't lowered my lake as much as usual over the winter yet so if that Black River gets up and over the St. John creek dam again with the levels already up it's gonna be dicey!  Michael

Lower Buckhorn is showing a lot of open water already check out the webcams from Reach Harbour Resort here if you are interested just click on the webcam tab at the top of the page there are 3 cams  http://www.reachharbour.com/  Enjoy!! Kawartha Kev
honey harbour

^ Wow can't believe that Honey Harbour picture , crazy winter to say the least ! Still lots of ice Parry Sound and north from what I have been told but its melting fast . It is suppose to cool down next week a bit which will sustain some of the ice but it will be an early ice out i'm sure .
Ice melted quite a bit in a week!!
Haliburton was making ice this morning, popping like crazy.  Now that it's past my point of feeling safe, I'm hoping it goes as quick as possible.

Same here Chris, was walking out the door with a fishing rod in my hand to deliver, heard a crack (oh expletive expletive expletive), thought I'd caught the rod on the door. Went back in, turned on the lights to check the rod (door is still open) and heard crack crack crack! I'm very close to the water (ice) here so of course I had to invest the 12 steps or so to stand at the shore and listen to the symphony. Of course I had to stick my toe on the new ice - where it was water yesterday - and found almost 3/4" had reformed. That was as far as I was gonna check even though the rest of the lake is still pretty much frozen, no way I was gonna volunteer to find out how much!  Michael
Flood watch in Burnt River area

-17 last night and the same again tonight, ice was still mostly safe but this will help with trouble spots like springholes and current areas.  Now we just need some snow to help with late season concrete out there right now.
sturgeon still ice locked has some open areas in normal river areas, lots of damage from ice movement this year, may be as much as 2 weeks before a boat goes in

sturgeon still ice locked has some open areas in normal river areas, lots of damage from ice movement this year, may be as much as 2 weeks before a boat goes in  No ice in sight down my way. Sturgeon's south end is wide open.
Flood watch in Burnt River area I was there today and lucky its not as bad as the past few years right now.
4ML today.  The white ice close to shore was 3 1/2 to 4" thick still and 1/2 that was clear black ice.  I broke a large chunk out as there are SO many cracks in it.
North east Pigeon still frozen. Water levels rising.
I read that Cook's Bay was about 40 % clear of ice this morning...I hope to get down to the north shore of Pigeon tomorrow to take a couple of pictures...
Water levels rising. Driving through Fenelon Falls today all the chambers at the damn were open letting a LOT of water out of Cameron

This is a shot of the north shoreline, there is a thin shell of ice near shore but the lake proper is still covered:    A shot from our launch at the lagoon:    Probably a couple of weeks before the lake itself will be clear...

No ice in sight down my way. Sturgeon's south end is wide open.  i was down that way, open to just north of greens then starts locking up again, was iced over by cliffs place other than some shoreline that was open and around moorings in the slips was open Saturday but with the two cold nights frozen again this morning
Heres are pics from yesterday.  Upper Simcoe and the Barrie marina.  Both spots were making ice. During my coffee at minets point, the ice was pinging and banging.
Gull Lake Friday.  There's some idiot in a canoe out there.
Gull Lake Friday.  There's some idiot in a canoe out there.
Gull Lake Friday.  There's some idiot in a canoe out there.         A mans got to do, what a mans got to do to fish.

Ice is solid in front of my place again this morning as for as far as I can see in any direction. there was a bit of open water at the shore yesterday but that froze over last night and I could walk on it this morning (only about a foot of water under it LOL). Looks like there could be a lot of damage over on the other side of the lake near Betty's Bay area. I can see the ice piled up on the shore over there so it has to be 6-8' high at least!
